titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Caroline Farrar Ware (UNESCO) Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 09:20

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, background materials, and drafts for The Twentieth Century, by Caroline F. Ware, K. M. Panikkar, and J. M. Romein. The book is volume six of History of Mankind, a work authorized by the UNESCO International Commission for a History of the Scientific and Cultural Development of Mankind.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Caroline F. Ware in 1967; Eugene N. Anderson, 1978; and the estate of Caroline F. Ware, 1990.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Caroline Farrar Ware Papers. Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Caroline Farrar Ware, a professor of history and social science, received her A.B. from Vassar in 1920, her A.M. from Radcliffe in 1924, and her Ph.D. in 1925. Ware was an associate professor of history at Vassar from 1925-1930 and from 1932-1934. She taught social science at Sarah Lawrence from 1935-1937, and was an associate professor at American University from 1936-1940. Ware was a lecturer at the American University School of Social Sciences and Public Affairs from 1940-1954, and a professor at the Howard University School of Social Work from 1945-1961. She was the editor-author of the volume of UNESCO History of Science and Cultural Development of Mankind. Ware died in 1990.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence, background materials, and drafts for The Twentieth Century, by Caroline F. Ware, K. M. Panikkar, and J. M. Romein. The book is volume six of History of Mankind, a work authorized by the UNESCO International Commission for a History of the Scientific and Cultural Development of Mankind.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

did.unittitle: Materials filed by chapters, using final chapter numbering of book. (Note: These folders do not contain correspondence re the chapters with Romein, Panikkar, Turner or Metraux; the correspondence folders for these four persons have been indexed for material relating to specific chapters.) Each folder contains:
Drafts prior to "First Draft" which was circulated to Unesco National Commissions and consulting scholars for comment
Introduction - Chapters I -IV (no preliminary Chapter V)
Comments and revisions of biology section
Comments by science adviser and consultants et al.
O. Wetherill mss. with revisions - draft 1
Comments by science adviser and consultants
Comments and correspondence with science consultants and others
Part II - Transformation of Societies - Material by K, M, P - Impact Europe on Asia
Chapter XX - Main Changes in Concepts and Ideas
Philosophy - Material by J. Aler, J. Hollak, V. Burke
Drafts 1, 2, and 3 (for comments see Chapter XII)
Hinduism - Panikkar material; drafts 1 and 2 (for draft 4)
Draft 3 (after circulation of draft 2 as "First Draft")
Chapter XXVIII - National Self-Image and Aspirations
Chapter XIX - Drive for Cultural Integrity and Recognition
Drafts only for Japan, Mexico, and Brazil (rest of draft missing)
Chapter XXX - Drive for Industrial Freedom and Human Dignity
Chapter XXXI - Literature and Arts in Western Culture Areas
Romein suggestions following final work session and HDL revisions
Chapter XXXII - Eastern Literature and Arts
Articles for the Journal of World History -Correspondence
Plans for article series and lists
Suggestions, plans, negotiations, articles not received
Trip around the world, 1955-1956 -Interview notes and correspondence
Japan, Thailand, Indonesia, Hong Kong and Singapore, Burma, India, Pakistan, Iraq, Lebanon, Egypt, Turkey
Inteviews not on trip: Iran, China
Correspondence with Science adviser and Consultants (See also chapters VI, VIII, XIII, and XV for other letters from these sources)
General editorial instructions and dates of chapter drafts
Working outlines and sketches of content
Comment on plan by USSR and CFW reply
Other comments on general outline and sections
Author-Editors' work sessions and meetings with Bureau of International Commission
Meeting of Bureau attended by author-editor, Paris
Minor revisions of final text suggested by Soviet scholars
"First Draft" as circulated to Unesco National Commissions in member countries and to cooperating scholars (lacks copy of Chapter XII - Biological Sciences)
Comments Received on First and Final Drafts
Memoranda and unpublished articles prepared for Author-Editors
Articles by P. Machwe, J. Mellquist, C. Gamba, S. El-Ali
Revisions in light of comments received from Unesco Commissions and other scholars -in pencil, ink, or inter-leaf
Revisions at final work session April 1960 in red
Correspondence with officials of International Commission
Guy S. Métrauz, Secretary-General -I, II, and III
Correspondence re Author-Editors' protest re proposed alternative Russian texts
Correspondence with General Editor -Ralph E. Turner
Pamphlets (and books) on India and Pakistan
Ministry of Education, Government of India. Pamphlets on Education
Shrimali, K. I. Better Teacher Education
Menon, T. K. N. and G. N. Kaul.
